body: Everything seems fine. Readme shows commands to reproduce our results.

Thanks, @glenn-jocher,

One more question:
to get similar map as that in YOLOv3 paper, how many epochs are needed to train?

Thanks,
Ardeal
Command to reproduce our map is in the readme.

Hi, @glenn-jocher,

I mean I would like to get similar mAP as that in Yolov3 paper, but not to reproduce the mAP.
How many epochs should I train?


Thanks,
Yes, training commands to reproduce our results are in the readme.
@ardeal is there anything you should do? I have no idea what you are trying to do in the first place.

@glenn-jocher ,
Hi,

Comparing the p, r, map and mf1 in my table with corresponding curve in your link, I think my training is very close to your training result.

I got 2 questions:
1) p, r, map and mf1 in my table from the beginning a few epochs is very close to your training result. this is very weird. According to my understanding, p, r, map and mf1 should increase slowly until the end of the final epoch(300).  
2) p, r, map and mf1 in my table is very close to your training result, does this mean that my training could be ended? is  the evaluation accuracy of my training the same as yours?

Thanks,  
Ardeal
@ardeal analysis of your results is up to you, I can't advise you on your own results.

@glenn-jocher ,

Hi,
I plotted the data in results.txt file. the curves seem different from yours in readme.

Is there anything about those curves I plotted?
